title: The real reason people hate Yasuo
body: He's annoying to play against. Double Crit chance, a free shield, bonus armor pen, what feels like unlimited dashes, strong dueling potential, no resources so he can spam, a knock up, a wall that negates half the champions in the game, and the people who play him are usually toxic. Is Yasuo broken? No, hes not at all broken, infact he can be easily countered and is likely to die to ganks. Yasuo also has a larger learning curb. Is he annoying and a bit anti-fun for people not playing him? Yes, more than any assassin or tank in the game.

replies.body:
Well.. guess your right.. 
Ehm... But what i personally hate about him is his voiceover. Like everytime i get a Yas in my game i mute the voice volume in option.  Well it´s maybe just me but still wanted to mention..

He's too edgy. Even his title "the unforgiven" and his story about being framed, and while I get that each champ needs to be unique, he's kind of a "chosen one" sort of character, as the only person able to use the wind technique.

That kind of happens when the only dojo around that teaches the technique gets obliterated and you happen to be the only of its students to have survived. And then of course he's blamed for it because there's evidence of *another wind technique user being the culprit*. I'd probably be pretty edgy too if everyone I knew, including my own brother, started hunting me down for a crime I didn't commit.

I think, that the problem is, that he is Designed to be too "cool" and "edgy". 
LIke: 
"Look at him he´s the lonely Samurai/Cowboy(?), he is so cool!!"
"That´s good, mate.."
"LOOK AT HIM HOW EDGY HE IS!!!!"
"Yo, bruh, calm down.."
"LOOK AT HIM!!!!"

I mean, yeah? Are 'cool' and 'edgy' characters only allowed on accident? Is that even possible?

Every character is designed with something in mind, and pretty much all of them can be boiled down to cliches and tropes. Yasuo isn't unique in this regard. Lots of other characters are just as or are more edgy. Zed, Varus, Aatrox, Darius, Kalista, etc. 
Varus says stuff like "Beware a man with nothing to lose" and "I am forsaken." but nobody gives him shit for it. Varus's lore is even basically just "he's the best at bow and being honorable so he was the super specialist guard against evil!" 
It's just because people have this mindless hate on for Yasuo that he gets shit on for everything. It's like people just go looking for things to make fun of him for at this point.

I have to admit, that you are right. Of course there cannot be an edgy char by accident. And people are looking for stuff to make yasuo shitty, BUT... you have to admit that Yasuo is an easy target! Look, the char ingame design, the voice-over, the lore and last but not least the usual attitude of people playing him (btw. had just a game against a Yasuo mid, all stereotypes were wunderfully approved, i was the weird tank Diana top, look it up :)  ) are the perfact combination for some good ol´ salt.

Oh no definitely. I don't deny that Yasuo's a pretty cliche character. I'm just saying it's not really fair that people shit on him for it when nobody gives any of the other champs shit for doing the same thing.

Not that there's anything wrong with cliches and tropes. They're cliches and tropes for a reason.

Well, Zed players always think, they are the new faker, Riven players have always noob teams and deserve challenjour, Blitz players are fukin annoin to play against(laugh spam all the time), 
Nasus NEVER leaves Toplane, Draven players are worshippers  of Tyler1, Lee Sin players always go 1v5, because they finally landed that "q" ... gimme some time and i´ll figure out some more.

Darius and Aatrox aren't edgy, just bloodthirsty mongrols.

Kalista, Varus, Zed, and Yasuo are.

Kalista: loses everything and is bent on revenge cliche
Varus needs a lore update, but similar to Kalista.
Yasuo follows this too.

They're all Anakin Skywalkers.

Zed's the exception, he's just an evil ninja who looks like he popped out of an anime (sasuke from Naruto?)
That's pretty rude comparing them all to Anakin Skywalker. They never jumped at their master who had the high ground and lost their legs like a dingus.

TFW you find out everyone you knew and love was either dead or missing

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WWaLxFIVX1s

MB, Darth Vader is a better comparison, although they're the same person..
"YOU'RE NOT LOOKING!!!@! LET ME MAKE HIM DASH TO YOUR FACE 7 TIMES IN A ROW SO YOU SEE HIM!!" - Riot Champion Development Team, Season 3
Now you just shut your mouth right now. Do not besmirch the greatness that is Liam O' Brian!
This man gets it.
NEVER!
I feel that way about annie. I hate that laugh
Also don't forget that a majority of Yasuo mains were played by a bunch of whiny 10-13 years old kids or some immature adult who has a strong sense of weebo in him.
Because the vast majority of other players are clearly level headed and mature adults.
Yes, we all non-Yasuo and non-Riven players are very elegant gentlemen, always equipped with good manners and superiour "LCS BIG-PLAYZ"

> [{quoted}](name=EvilDeBeagle,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Q2jNziO5,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2017-04-04T14:47:38.584+0000)
>
> Yes, we all non-Yasuo and non-Riven players are very elegant gentlemen, always equipped with good manners and superiour "LCS BIG-PLAYZ"

Oooooooooooohhhhh.  He just PWNed U!  GGEZ!
Overkill!

fuck yasuo and all but can we stop saying this about him

> free shield

the whole point of a PASSIVE is that is is FREE

> [{quoted}](name=Mecha MaIphite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Q2jNziO5,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-04-04T14:11:02.821+0000)
>
> fuck yasuo and all but can we stop saying this about him
> 
> the whole point of a PASSIVE is that is is FREE

Yes, But yasuos passive has like three different functioning parts something most other champs don't have. It's overloaded and should be just one of the three, ( MS,Sheild, or double crit) Not all of the above.

Well so does Jhin but I don't see people complaining about *his* passive.

People only complain about Yasuo's three passives because it's on a single ability, but other champs mutiple passives as well they're just one different abilities. Nobody complains about Garen's free armor/MR passive on top of his healing passive, or Jinx's auto attack modifying Q passive on top of her speed steroid passive, or Zed's passive bonus AD on top of his execute autos, or etc. Thresh has three passives as well, where are the threads complaining about him?

Here's why those Passover get slack vs yasuo. They are weak on their own. 

Garen and Sion's infinite stacking passives only become a problem if you allow it to be as they only gain it via farming and they'd need to farm a lot for a noticeable effect. 

Jinx's standard passive only activates when an objective or kill is taken and jinx participated. It's situational and only serves to allow jinx to clean up fights rather then dominate. 

Zed has always gotten shit for his passive, people just hate his ult more.

Thresh's passive is, like garen and sion before, only a problem if you let it go unchecked. In exchange for no scaling armor, he gets a small amount of armor and ap permanently for collecting souls of which he has no control over when they spawn outside of large monsters/cannons/champions 

Bottom line is, the "extra" passives often are situational and require just as much setup as execution.(except zed but no one likes him either)

Yasuo' passive give him free Crits, ms, and a shield and the only cost is a crit damage reduction of 10% which is immediately off set by an infinity edge which is a core item. Throw in his q's passive and his Ults unique mechanics and the frustration is understandable.

You forgot Jhin, who's passive gives him a guaranteed crit every fourth shot with execute damage, MS, and a ton of bonus AD.

Yasuo pays more for his passive than you let on. Compare to other melee champions, he has less base HP, less health regen, less armor, and less magic resist (**which doesn't scale, a standard feature to melee champions**). He's a melee champion that's only *just barely* beefier than marksman all because of his shield (which is easily popped by the way). But you clearly don't know what you're talking about, after all you think his passive gives him ms (what??????)

I forgot to address jhin, let me do so now. His passive is indeed strong, but cost is his overall dps. Jhin is a marksman that deals damage in burst as opposed to his peers who do so through dps. This is meaningful when dealing with tanks who are accustom to dealing with burst making him rather weak to tanks, and before you even speak of lethality nonsense, Jhin is the only adc who SHOULDN'T build it since his passive rewards crit builds far more then lethality.

As for Yasuo, I poorly attributed his mobility to his passive instead of his e (my bad) but my overall point remains the same, though I will reiterate as it seems it went misunderstood. Yasuo's passive is annoying due to how it gives him far more damage and survivability then he technically should and its incredibly frustrating as yasuo does very little for his power. Yes, he statically "pays" for his passive by having weaker base stats overall, but that isn't conveyed to his opponent in game through any notable means. His health bar, visually is around the same length as yours and taking damage in the early game hurts equally hard. Its only in the highest of tiers that Yasuo's sacrifices become truly noticeable. 

I should mention that I don't consider Yasuo OP. In-fact I kinda consider him weak overall. The Massive load he can be towards his team at times, the way he subtly punishes his team for not putting him first in team comp decisions, and the whole house of cards nature of his play style (i.e. he either wins or loses big with no real middle ground) puts him firmly in this position for me. I only contest that he is in essence in a similar position as teemo. Really annoying to play against and might even cost you a game, but for every one that destroys you, their will be 4 that just get destroyed.
they dont, but i will say this csing with no ad on garen is way to fkin easy.
He has his shield because he has no scaling MR and he has really low base HP and HP regen. So it's definitely not "free" as everyone puts it, he pays for it with lower base stats.

What is he paying to have the 2x crit and built in Armor pen on his ult. the pen only applies on crits? 

{{item:3031}} ECKS{{item:3046}}  DEEE
Do you mean besides the fact that his crits do less damage than everyone else's crits and being a very squishy ***melee*** champion?
I can't think of any other champion that can go 0/6 in the lane and then finish a second item and then be so strong he needs to be focused in a fight or he'll kill everyone.

I would be 100% fine with him if he didn't have his passive shield. I shouldn't have to make sure the shield is down before engaging him or else I auto lose due to simply not being able to match his DPS. The wind wall is fine, annoying, but you can bait it out and it has a long cooldown. But that in conjunction with his passive shield and mobility just makes him a bit too safe against most matchups. 

If I could just all-in him all the time and not have to worry about taking free damage because of a shield a lot of melee champs can't actually get rid of beforehand thanks to the wall, he would be in a healthy spot.

The shield is there because he has much lower base HP, HP regen and no scaling MR compared to others of similar play style. If they were to remove the shield they'd have to buff his stats to compensate, otherwise he'd be extremely weak.

(Kat picked as random mid assassin with higher HP and HP regen than Yas, all ranged champs have "no scaling MR", Kat has scaling MR, but (surprise surprise) Yasuo only has 1 ability that is affected by MR)
Katarina begins the game with +70 HP and +1 Health regen over Yasuo.  She ends with +70 HP and -2 health regen over Yasuo.  Yasuo BEGINS with a 100 HP shield (so +30 HP) and ends with a 510 shield (ie. +440 HP on Kat)

Something else to note, since the shield is basically "functional" HP (blocks all damage including true damage), this means the following:
At Rank 1, Yasuo gains flow at a rate of 1 per 59 units moved.  Yasuo base movement is 345, so Yasuo gains ~6 flow per second, or takes 17 seconds to regain his shield.  Kat (just as example) has +1 HP regen on Yasuo for 7.5 HP per 5 secs (way it works).  

That means, if both take half health in an early trade, Yasuo is at 259 HP and Kat is at 295.  In 17 secs, Yasuo will be at 281 HP and Kat will be at 321 HP (320.5 rounded up).  But Yasuo's shield will be back, but him at 381 "effective" health, to Kat's 321.  And looked at fully, it'd go more like this:
Start of lane:
Yasuo = 518 HP + 100 HP shield = 618 functional HP
Katarina = 590 HP

Assuming no equipment (not getting into builds or whatever) with 1 Q and 3 AAs we get this:
Yasuo -> 129.9 (AA dmg (accounting for base armor)) + 20 (Q dmg) = 150 HP dmg to Kat
Kat -> 140.5 (AA dmg (accounting for base armor)) + 75 (Q dmg) - 100 (shield) = 116 HP dmg to Yasuo

Kat has -34 HP deficit after 3 AAs (+Q), again, in 17 secs, Kat will regain about 26 HP, Yasuo will "effectively" regain 122 HP.
So, despite starting the game with higher: HP, HP regen, Armor, Base Attack Damage, PLUS having a Q that does more than triple the dmg of Yasuo's, Kat will be at a DEFICIT of -30 HP ACTUAL health, and -130 "effective" health at 17 seconds simply because of Yasuo's shield passive.

*Note, Q is Kat's highest lvl 1 dmg spell and (aside from 0 dmg Windwall) Yasuo's lowest, and since the shield scales with level, these only get worse as the champs go up, considering that all of their base stats either scale at basically the same rate OR in Yasuo favor (HP regen for Yasuo higher at Level 18)

You seem to be disregarding the ease with which most mid-laners can pop his shield, including kat. It's one of the most important forms of counterplay available to his lane opponents. Yasuo players **want** to go in at full flow, trade blows, and back off before their opponents' higher base damages can be brought to bear. That's where his early strengths lie, but by keeping his shield down, it creates an extended window of weakness, same as any other major cooldown.

Problem is, few champs have the flexibility to do so. 

Mana is the key factor here. Using a spell to pop his shield is often more wasteful then trying to punch through it as he'll get it back long before the mana regens. Smart yasuo' s can't be beaten by attrition since they can clear waves really easy, even when behind. But forcing a fight on your terms is difficult as he has plenty of counters in his kit. To beat him in lane you'd need diligent support from your jungler and/or a laner who excels at both close range and killing momentum.

Hence why his more consistent "counters" are Annie and Rumble. Mainly for their ability to stop/limit yasuo during a team fight solo while still having plenty of power and aoe to contribute to the team damage wise.

There are, what, 2 melee mid-laners without free ranged harass? The vast majority of mid-laners can use ranged autoattacks to pop the shielf, and only Ekko and Talon come to mind and champions who have to burn mana to poke him.

Predictability

This makes what should be an easy to manage mechanic more frustrating then not.

Simply put, if Yasuo can see that your trying to pop his shield, he has a plethora of tools to punish that attempt in some fashion. He could all-in and force a fight while his shield is up if he deems you as weak enough to fight. He could throw up his wind wall and deny cs forcing you to either do nothing while its up, or go all-in yourself on his terms. He could also use the time to quickly clear the wave and retreat thus forcing you to decide to either risk losing farm or risk losing the ability to capitalize on his lack of shield. 

Yes, Yasuo could screw up and it could cost him his life, but the reason he's annoying is that when it comes down to it. Its in Yasuo's hands who wins or loses a trade.

Personally, I don't think he's OP. He's got to many flaws which reveal themselves in the mid to late game that puts in a position I'd not want to be with. He wins or loses big with no real middle-ground and leaves him too volatile for me to really put up with. I'd rather someone with a more consistent advantage and consistent weakness rather then a champ that is a balanced like a house of cards.

Incredibly impressive, High skill ceiling, but falls apart easily and requires too much setup.

Now you're not even complaining about a specific mechanic, you're going on about how many options Yasuo has. That complaint is perfectly valid; Yasuo has tremendous agency over the laning phase in most situation. But, none of what you actually said matters so long as if you're playing right, unless you're Ekko or Talon.

If you have free ranged harass, then all yasuo can do is dodge, use his W, or go in. The former doesn't matter because you wasted nothing and using his W means it's much easier to harass or even all in. It's only if he engages that things get murkier. If you auto-lose to his engage, then you outplayed yourself by mispositioning, but if that isn't the case, then you have to outplay him, just like you would with any other champ.

As I said, I think he's annoying and sympathize with the general hate towards him. As you noticed, I am not complaining about specific mechanics anymore. That's because I agree that he isn't as big of a threat as he is made out to be.

However, he is a massive annoyance and that is a stance that is born from emotions and frustration. His kit "has no counter-play" because if you goof up once he typically gets a kill because the strength of his kit comes from how quickly his abilities follow up on each other. It doesn't matter that his damage is mostly single target, or that he depends on his teammates to reliably land his ult during teamfights without dying immediately after. 

The only time I truly felt Yasuo was bullshit OP was when his bruiser build ({{item:3022}}  {{item:3025}}  {{item:3053}} ) was viable.
Full disclosure, I miss Frozen Force.
The shield is not effective, and it has more counterplay then just stat-checking.
because the ones on my team are dog shit but the enemy yasuo will get double kills before he's even level 6

His windwall lasts way too long, and I agree that he can zone too long when he is ready to throw his tornado.

I also get very tired listening to all his sound effects.
Taking away one of his passives would make him less annoying to play against. Like maybe take away his shield and give him actual mana costs so the only thing he can now spam at you is his mastery.
I don't think Wind Wall should counter ults from Nami/Sona and others.   It's a bit overpowered.

His annoying mostly because his E let's him dash to do you relatively easily. More so, he can hold his Q so long to zone you. 

His a bully in lane but some how ends by being a hyper carry. You can shut him down but one or two idea and suddenly he is shredding tanks

You wanna know a brain dead counter him - Swain

You wanna know an absolute godly counter to him but it requires a lot of skill - Xerath
